data: BMT Patient Controlled Analgesia (PCA) Opioid Extreme (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Restricted to Department of Bone Marrow Transplant Service (VGH)
Patient Care
Vital Signs
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Pulse Oximetry
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Sedation Assessment
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Sedation Assessment
If Sedation Score (POSS) 3 or greater:
Pain Assessment
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Respiratory Rate
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 4 hour, then q2h for 24 hour, then q4h for duration of PCA use
Respiratory Rate
If Respiratory Rate is 8/min or less:
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when Sedation Score (POSS) 3 AND Respiratory rate greater than 8/min, then Hold PCA until POSS 2 or less
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when Sedation Score (POSS) 3 or greater AND Respiratory rate equal to or less than 8/min, then Hold PCA and give naloxone
For patients at risk for increased respiratory depression (e.g. severe OSA):
Respiratory Rate
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 24 hour, then q4h
Sedation Assessment
q15min for 30 minute, then q1h for 24 hour, then q4h
Following increase in PCA Dose or decrease in lockout interval:
Respiratory Rate
q1h, for 2 hour, then PRN
Sedation Assessment
q1h, for 2 hour, then PRN
Communication Order
Do NOT give any Opioids, CNS Depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by the Bone Marrow Transplant Service
Monitor Urine Output
Contact provider for urinary retention
